conclusion: To determine where liquid from points A, B, C, and D will flow into containers E, F, G, and H, analyze the path of each liquid stream based on the provided images.
Point A is green and flows down along the leftmost green bar.
The green liquid from point A continues flowing downward, hits a diagonal baffle, veers to the right, and falls into container E.
Point B is yellow and flows down along the second bar from the left.
The yellow liquid from point B hits a diagonal baffle but continues to flow straight down due to the alignment of the baffles and falls into container F.
Point C is yellow and flows down along the third bar from the left.
The yellow liquid from point C hits another diagonal baffle, flows slightly rightward, and falls into container G.
Point D is pink and flows down along the rightmost bar.
The pink liquid from point D hits a diagonal baffle, flows slightly leftward, and falls into container H.
Liquid from A flows into container E, liquid from B flows into container F, liquid from C flows into container G, and liquid from D flows into container H.
